column6: Text
Once upon a time, a family lived in the countryside in their farm.
Their son was a simpleton.
One day, a witch stole the sun.
The crops wouldn't grow anymore and the family was starving.
The son decided to chase the witch.
Her mother gave him a knitted hat.
The son ran to the faint sunlight and caught the witch.
The witch flung rocks at him.
He flung the rocks back at the witch and a big one hit her bag.
Out of the witch's bag came out the sun.
With the sun high in the sky, the son returned home.
The witch transformed into a beautiful lady.
Then she chased the son and tried to entice him to go with her.
The magical hat showed the son the witch's true intentions.
He escaped the witch and got home safe and sound.
A poor mother lived in a little house with her two sons.
There was famine and she could barely feed her sons.
One day a hungry snake walked nearby.
The snake looked through the window and saw the younger son unattended.
The snake crawled in and took the younger son with her.
The mother saw her younger son missing.
She asked her older son to go look for his younger brother.
The older brother was very responsible and agreed.
He left the house and went into the woods.
In the woods he met the snake's wife.
The snake's wife asked him to go into her burrow.
The older brother agreed.
As soon as the snake's wife turned around he struck her and killed her.
He went into the snake's burrow.
Inside he ate the snake's eggs.
The snake came out of the deeper part of the burrow.
The snake saw his eggs missing and died of sadness.
The older brother now was well fed.
He retrieved his younger brother from the deeper part of the burrow.
They arrived home safely.
As a strong and healthy man, the older brother quickly found a bride.
A girl lived with her brother.
Her brother could not find a bride.
Their father threatened to marry them if he would not find a bride.
The girl was terrified.
She decided to try to find a bride for her brother.
At night she sneaked out of the house.
She found a little box.
She put the little box in her pocket.
The box belong to the forest witches.
They pulled the girl to their lair up in the trees.
The witches wanted the box open.
With her delicate fingers, the girl opened the box.
From inside the box came a frog.
The girl put the frog in her pocket.
The witches kept the box and were very happy.
They gave the girl fine vests and jewelry.
When the girl came down a prince saw her.
He wed her immediately.
The girl's brother came to the wedding.
He saw the frog in the girl's pocket.
He kissed the frog and the frog transformed into a princess.
The brother married the other princess and they all lived happily.
An old couple lived in a hut with their adopted son.
The boy had a magical bird that could control the weather.
They used the bird's predictions to make it rain on their crops and were always prosperous.
A jealous neighbor learned about the bird.
The neighbor told the boy he needed to borrow the bird.
But the boy wouldn't let him take it.
The neighbor took the bird and locked it into a cage.
A mouse nearby saw everything.
Later, the mouse asked the boy for some food.
The kind-hearted boy gave the mouse some nuts.
Instead of eating the nuts, the mouse planted them and from them a rock sprouted from the ground.
The mouse told the boy that if he could break the rock, he would be able to free his bird.
The boy used his parent's cart to break the rock.
From inside the rock a key emerged which opened the bird's cage.
The boy ended up marrying a girl from the village and they all were happy.
Once upon a time there lived an old widow without any children.
A witch told her she would give her a child if the woman would return the child on his second birthday.
The woman agreed and became pregnant and gave birth to a boy.
The eve of the boy's second birthday, the old mother hid the boy underground.
The witch came the next day but could not find the boy.
The witch cursed the boy and transformed him into a cat.
Years passed and everyday the mother would sing to the cat and tell him about his story.
One day the cat decided he could no longer bear his mother's sadness and decided to leave.
The cat left the house and boarded a ship.
Years passed and the ship eventually returned to the cat's home town.
The cat went back home and saw her mother happy with another cat.
His mother wouldn't recognize him and locked him out.
The other cat was the witch's in disguise.
The witch asked the mother to kill the boy.
The boy had to prove to her mother that he was his son.
He sang the song her mother used to sing to him.
The mother then realized who her son really was.
She took a shovel and killed the witch.
At this moment the spell broke and the boy regained his human form.
He was a good looking lad that had no trouble finding a wife.
An old couple lived with their daughter in a farm.
The mother died of illness.
The widower eventually married a widow that had a daughter of her own.
The stepmother was always cruel to the poor girl.
One night a group of pirates came to the farm.
They spied the family through the windows.
Once the family was asleep the pirates kidnapped the father and stepmother.
The next morning, the girl and her stepsister couldn't find their parents.
They decided to go look for them.
They took separate ways.
The girl found an old lady.
The old lady asked her help her pick apples from the top of an apple tree.
The girl climbed the tree and gave the apples to the old lady.
It was getting dark and both girls decided to go back home.
The girl was still atop the tree when she saw the pirates come back.
The pirates saw her.
One of the pirates had iron teeth and began chewing on the tree.
But the girl was very agile and jumped from tree to tree until she arrived home.
The pirates surrounded the farm with the two girls inside.
But then, the old lady from earlier heard their voices and made the pirates stop.
The old lady was partly blind and asked the girls if they had helped her.
The stepsister, immediately jumped and told the old lady she had helped her.
The other girl implored the old lady to take her but free her parents.
The old lady smelled the apples on the girl.
She cursed at the stepsister for being a liar.
The pirates freed the girl's father.
The stepmother and stepsister were taken by the pirates and sold as slaves.
The girl was married to a captain and lived a good life at sea.
Once upon a time, in a land, far, far away.
There lived a girl with her baby brother and her mother.
One day, the mother went to the market.
The mother told the girl to watch her baby brother.
The girl started playing and soon forgot what her mother had asked her.
A nearby witch saw the baby brother unattended and took him away.
After a while, the girl came back and realized her baby brother was missing.
The girl suspected the witch may be behind.
She decided to go save her brother and went on to the witch's hut.
She made her way in and waited for the witch.
While waiting, a bear came and knocked on the door.
The bear asked the girl for food.
The girl prepared some porridge and fed it to the bear.
The bear told the girl he would fight the witch in return.
Then a little mouse came from a little hole in the wall.
The mouse asked the girl what she was doing there.
The girl told the mouse about her missing baby brother.
The mouse told her that a little boy was being kept captive in a cellar under the hut.
The girl found a trap door leading to the cellar where she met her brother.
The girl pulled her brother from the cellar and escaped.
They both returned home safe and sound.
Once upon a time, in a land, far, far away.
There lived a girl with her baby brother and her mother.
One day, the mother went to the market.
The mother told the girl to watch her brother.
The girl started playing and soon forgot what her mother had asked her.
A nearby witch smelled the baby brother and took him away.
When the girl could not find her brother home, she became concerned and left looking for him.
The girl ran into a magic apple tree and asked the tree if she had seen her brother.
The tree asked the girl to eat one of her apples before telling her where her brother was.
The girl refused to eat an apple and the tree did not tell her.
The girl continued looking for her brother and eventually followed a little path that led to a wicked little cabin.
The girl saw her brother inside.
The girl grabbed her brother and ran away.
The girl started running back home.
The witch saw the girl running and started chasing after them.
The girl ran into the magic apple tree and asked for help.
The apple tree asked the girl to eat an apple.
The girl ate an apple.
Then, the apple tree hid her under her branches.
The witch passed by and did not see the girl.
The girl and her baby brother arrived it home in time before her mother came back from the market.
Once upon a time there was a happy queen with a son and a daughter.
In the kingdom lived a witch that was jealous of their happiness.
The witch devised a plan to ruin their family.
The witch visited them.
She gave the prince a ring and told him that he would be happy as long as he married a girl who the ring would fit.
Years passed but the boy could not find a girl who the ring would fit.
One day, his sister saw the ring and tried it on.
The ring fit perfectly and she couldn't take it off.
He immediately asked her to marry him.
The girl panicked and escaped the palace.
She walked though the forest until she reached a lonely hut.
Inside there was a maiden.
The maiden was the daughter of a witch.
The maiden was lonely and asked the girl to be friends.
The girl agreed.
They talked for hours.
The next day the maiden asked the girl for help braiding a handkerchief.
The girl agreed.
Together they braided a beautiful handkerchief.
The maiden asked the girl to keep it as a token of their friendship.
The girl was ready to return home and face her fate.
Then the witch appeared from the sky.
The witch smelled the girl and wanted to eat her.
The maiden hid the girl from the witch.
When she couldn't find her, the witch left and the girl escaped safely.
The girl arrived home and found her brother sobbing in her absence.
Her brother apologized to her for his behavior.
Eventually both the brother and sister married royalty from neighboring kingdoms and were happy ever after.
Once there lived a rich merchant with a beautiful daughter.
The merchant sent her daughter to marry the kingdom's prince.
The daughter parted with a maidservant.
The maidservant was jealous.
The maidservant stole the merchant's daughter clothes and left her to be eaten by the wolves.
The maidservant arrived to the palace and met with the prince.
The prince was confused because of the lack of manners of the maidservant but married her anyway.
Meanwhile, a fairy found the merchant's daughter, took pity on her and gave her a pair of magic eyes.
The girl went to the palace the guards wouldn't let her in.
When the maidservant learned about the merchant's daughter still being alive was furious.
She asked the prince to go to the palace's doors and kill the merchant's daughter.
The merchant's daughter gave the magic eyes to the prince.
The prince saw the maidservant through the magic eyes.
He saw the horrible creature that she was in the inside.
The prince ordered the maidservant to be expelled from the palace.
The maidservant enraged and chased the merchant's daughter to kill her.
The maidservant cornered the merchant's daughter at the edge of a cliff.
The fairy converted the merchant's daughter into a dove and she escaped.
The maidservant fell off the cliff and died.
The dove flow back to the palace where she converted into a beautiful girl again.
The prince married her and they lived happily the rest of their lives.
In a kingdom far away there was a town terrified by a dragon.
One day the dragon kidnapped the princess.
The king issued a call for help.
A humble soldier responded to the call.
The king told the soldier he would make him a nobleman is he could rescue the princess.
The soldier agreed and departed.
After a few days, the soldier reached the den of the dragon.
The dragon ambushed him but the soldier was faster than him.
The dragon saw he could not win and asked the soldier for forgiveness.
The soldier ordered the dragon to leave and never come back.
He found the princess and rescued her.
They returned to the palace.
The soldier married the princess and they lived a happy and peaceful life.
Once upon a time, there was a soldier at the orders of certain king.
The soldier had many abilities and was always loyal.
The king could not find a bride.
The king commanded the soldier to go kidnap a princess for him to marry.
The soldier accepted the king's orders and prepared to leave.
He took a small company of soldiers and embarked on their journey.
After several days at sea, a terrible storm hit the ship.
The soldier stood firm at as the captain's post not matter what.
The ship was lifted from the sea and the soldier flew to a new kingdom.
There was a castle by a cliff where a maiden had been locked.
The soldier rescued the maiden from the castle.
They boarded the ship and returned home.
The king married the maiden.
The soldier was made a noble man by the king and married another lady in the court.
There was once a dragon that terrorized a little kingdom.
The dragon would kidnap the town's maidens.
One night the king had a dream where a tanner rescued his daughter from the dragon.
The next day, the princess had been kidnapped by the dragon.
The king approached the tanner and asked him to rescue his daughter.
Eventually the tanner conceded and prepared to go fight the dragon.
He took a big mace and parted to seek the dragon.
When he found the dragon he flung his mace at him.
The dragon died instantly.
The tanner rescued the princess.
They both came back to the palace.
The king offered the princess to the tanner in marriage.
But the tanner refused and went back to his old life.
A roaming gypsy caravan with a father and his blind child arrived at an isolated village.
There was a giant who had been terrorizing the village's folks.
The giant threatened to eat every single child if his demands were not met.
The gypsy met an old man.
The old man told him all about the giant.
The gypsy told the old man he would take care of the giant.
He grabbed a piece of soft cheese and went to meet the giant.
The gypsy tricked the giant into a contest to see who was stronger.
The giant smashed a rock with his hands.
The gypsy took the cheese and told the giant it was a rock.
The gypsy crumbled the cheese with a single hand.
When the giant saw that he became scared of the gypsy.
The giant fled the village and never returned.
The gypsy was thanked and settled in the village.
A poor laborer lived in a small town.
His master's crops had been ruined and there was no work for him.
Eventually his master told him he had to let him go.
The laborer was very understanding.
He left the small town and headed to the city.
On the way there he ran into the bull that had been ruining all the crops.
The bull challenged him to a race.
The laborer agreed and the bull stormed out.
The laborer knew the land really well and instead of following the path he took a shortcut.
When the bull arrived at the goal, the laborer was already there waiting for him.
Ashamed, the bull promised to stop running and ruining the crops.
The laborer was able to find work in no time and was prosperous.
A woman was once kidnapped by a bear.
The woman gave birth to a bearlet who was half-boy and half-bear.
Eventually, the woman was able to escape and took the boy with her.
When they got back home, the woman's husband could not accept the bearlet.
He had a plan to get rid of the bearlet.
He told the bearlet that he would only let him stay if he got rid of the water spirits in the lake.
The bearlet left not knowing what to do.
He was sobbing loudly next to a lake when a water spirit came out of the lake.
The water spirit challenged him to see who could scream the loudest.
The bearlet and the water spirit took turns yelling and screaming.
The bearlet asked the water spirit to close his eyes.
Then, the bearlet smacked his head with a stick.
The water spirit thought that the bearlet's scream had shaken his head and gave up.
The water spirit conceded to the bearlet and went to live to another lake.
The bearlet came back home and his mother was very happy to see him again.
A soldier was given leave from his company.
He had only a piece of bread, a knapsack and a fiddle.
He was happy and left playing the fiddle.
A nearby devil heard the fiddle.
The devil approached the soldier and asked him to teach him how to play in exchange for a favor.
The soldier taught the devil how to play but did not ask the devil for any favors.
They parted ways.
After some time, the devil was tormenting the princess of the kingdom.
The king issued a call asking for help.
The soldier answered the call and interviewed with the king.
He assured the king he would be able to free the princess from her torments.
That night, the soldier stood awake in front of the princess' room.
At midnight the devil appeared.
Calling for the due favor, the soldier asked the devil to play a game of cards.
The soldier bested the devil at all the games of cards they played that night.
When the sun came out, the soldier told the devil to hide in his knapsack.
Then, the soldier beat the knapsack and killed the devil inside.
The princess was relieved and her father thankful.
The soldier married the princess and lived happy in the castle.
Once upon a time, a soldier deserted from his company.
He had only a piece of bread, a knapsack and a fiddle.
One night, the fugitive soldier got lost and stumbled into a devil.
The devil approached the soldier and asked him to teach him how to play the fiddle.
The soldier taught the devil how to play.
In exchange, the devil told the soldier how to talk to the Grim Reaper.
Time passed and the soldier found himself serving another king.
The king's daughter had been cursed and was very ill.
The soldier went to the king and asked for a chance to help the princess.
He took with him a deck of cards that had been rigged.
At night, he saw the Grim Reaper enter the princess' room.
He challenged him to a game of cards.
The soldier won the game and asked the Grim Reaper to leave the princess alone as his reward.
The curse was lifted and the princess was healthy again.
The king was so happy that he married his daughter to the soldier and made him a nobleman.
There once lived a poor and unlucky peasant.
He never married and was very lonely.
A fox came to him one day and told him that he could marry him to the princess.
The peasant was reluctant but then trusted the fox.
They left the hole where the peasant lived and headed to the palace.
The peasant followed the fox though a swamp.
They emerged from the swamp covered in mud.
A nearby water spirit was so scared when they saw them that died instantly.
When they reached the palace, the fox told the peasant to get rid of his filthy clothes.
Then, the fox told the king that the peasant was a prince and that his clothes had been lost fighting the water spirit.
The king was impressed by their feat and gave the peasant new clothes and jewelry.
Then the peasant married the princess and became a prince.
Satisfied with her deed, the fox returned home.
A long time ago, near the capital city, lived a family with their son.
A dragon terrorized the region.
The dragon wanted to take over the family's lands.
One day the parents went to the market.
The dragon set their house on fire but the boy was able to escape.
He wanted revenge and ran after the dragon but got lost.
The fireflies saw the courage of the boy and decided to show him the way to the dragon's den.
The dragon and the boy fought for a long time.
The dragon couldn't see the boy in the darkness and he managed to struck him in the head and kill him.
When the king learned about the feat of the boy he married him to his daughter.
The boy and his bride returned to his family's lands.
His parents were lamenting his death but were overjoyed to see him alive.
With their newfound wealth, they rebuilt their house and lived happily.
In a land far away, there lived a rich family with a single spoilt daughter.
One day, the parents to work.
The girl became hungry and decided to go find some food.
She went out in the forest and ran into a magic apple tree.
There were candied apples in the top of the tree but the girl couldn't reach.
The apple tree asked the girl to eat some of its green apples and then it would give her a candy apple.
The girl rejected the green apples.
The apple tree did not give her candied apples.
Further down the path she found a river of pudding.
The river asked her to eat some porridge and then it would hive her some pudding.
The girl refused to eat any porridge.
The river of pudding did not give her any pudding.
At the darkest part of the forest the girl found a house made of bread.
She asked for some gingerbread but the house told her she'd need to eat some rye bread first.
The girl said that she wouldn't eat any rye bread.
The house did not give her any gingerbread.
All of a sudden, Baba Yaga broke out of the house and started chasing the girl.
The house told her to eat some rye bread.
The girl ate some rye bread and started running faster than the witch.
She came into the river of pudding and the river of pudding told her to eat some porridge.
Then the girl ate some porridge and started leaping from tree to tree.
Eventually she came into the apple tree and the apple tree told her to eat a green apple.
Then the girl ate some green apples and the apple tree hid her from the witch.
When the witch was gone she was able to arrive home just in time before her parents came back from work.
An old widower lived with his daughter in a farm.
The widower eventually married another woman who had a daughter of her own.
The stepmother and stepdaughter despised the girl.
They asked her father to get rid of her.
The father took the girl to the forest and left her there to die.
A goblin saw the girl and asked her how she was doing.
The girl was kind to the goblin and they talked all night long.
The goblin thanked the girl for their conversation.
As a token of appreciation, he gave her new clothes and jewelry.
The next morning, the father went back to the forest to retrieve the girl's corpse.
He was very happy to see his daughter still alive and they went back to the farm.
When the stepmother saw the clothes and jewelry she got very excited.
She asked her husband to take her own daughter to the forest.
The husband took his stepdaughter to the forest and left her in the same spot.
The goblin saw the girl and approached her.
The girl was repulsed by the goblin and was mean to him.
The goblin killed the girl as punishment.
The next morning, the father went back to the forest to retrieve the girl.
He went back home with her corpse.
When the mother saw her dead daughter she died of sadness herself.
The girl and her father lived happily and she eventually married a good lad from a nearby farm.
Once upon a time there lived couple with their daughter.
The mother died.
Eventually, the father married an old widow who had a daughter of her own.
The woman's daughter was jealous of her stepsister's beauty.
She wanted to learn her secret.
The woman's daughter followed the girl everyday.
She learned that she drank the milk of a magic cow to keep beautiful.
She plotted to steal the cow's milk all for herself.
The magic cow knew about the stepsister's plan and asked the girl to kill her and bury her.
The girl did as the cow asked her.
From the remains of the cow grew a beautiful apple tree.
The girl sang every day by the apple tree remembering her magic cow.
The tree would some times sing back and the girl was happy.
One day a prince walked by and saw the apple tree.
The girl's stepsister introduced herself as the maid of the house.
The prince asked for an apple from the apple tree.
The stepsister was not able to reach any apples.
When the girl tried to reach one, the branches bent down for her to grab an apple.
Then the apple tree sang about the jealous stepsister.
When the prince heard the song commanded the stepsister to be executed.
He then married the girl and they lived happily ever after.
There once lived a priest with his son.
The boy was very strong and all the other children were afraid of him.
The villagers asked the priest to keep his son away from their families.
The priest kept the boy locked in a room.
One day, a bull came to town.
The bull ate the town's crops and ruined their fields.
The boy heard the villagers complaining and wanted to help them.
He escaped his room and went to the fields.
His strength was with him.
He found the bull in the fields.
The boy and the bull engaged in a fight.
The boy was able to eventually overcome the bull's strength.
The bull then became docile.
The boy tied a rope to the bull's neck and led it back to the village.
When he arrived, the villagers were overjoyed that the bull had been captured.
They used the bull and the boy's strengths to mend the fields and were prosperous.
Once upon a time there was a king who had three daughters.
Their mother died at childbirth.
The father, zealous of his daughters locked them in a tower of the palace.
One day, the girls escaped and ventured into one of the palace's gardens.
A dragon with three heads saw them and kidnapped them.
The king issued a call to all the knights of the kingdom.
Three heroes offered themselves to rescue the princesses.
They got weapons and armor and departed to encounter the dragon.
Each knight battled one head of the dragon.
Each knight succeeded and cut a dragon's head.
They rescued the princesses from the dragon's den.
And returned home to a happy father.
The king rewarded them with riches and made them noblemen.
In a faraway land lived a family with their son.
The son could understand the language of the birds.
A nightingale told the boy that one day his parents would be at his feet.
When the boy told their parents, the father became enraged.
The father expelled the son from home.
The son and the nightingale took off.
They boarded a ship to a foreign kingdom.
In that kingdom lived a king.
The king was annoyed because a family of crows would not stop cawing.
The boy went to the king and offered to translate for him.
The crows wanted the king to resolve a family dispute.
The king resolved it and the boy translated it to the crows.
When the crows left the king was very happy.
The king married his daughter to the boy and made him a prince.
The newlyweds went on their honeymoon.
By chance, they visited the city of the boy's family.
There, they were received as royalty and all the people bowed to them.
The boy recognized his parents and the nightingale's prophecy was fulfilled.
The boy forgave his parents and they all lived happily ever after.
An old man lived with his wife, his older daughter and younger son.
The daughter was jealous of all the attention her younger brother always received.
One day she went to the forest to pick up berries.
Her mother asked her to take her brother with her.
When they were in the forest, the girl asked her brother to lie down on the ground.
The boy did as his sister told him.
Then the girl stabbed him and buried him.
From the ground where the boy was buried a little shrub soon sprouted.
A shepherd ran into the shrub, cut it and made a flute out of it.
When he played the flute it sang a song.
The flute told the shepherd to go to the old man's house.
When the shepherd played the flute there, the flute sang about the daughter's murder.
The old man expelled his daughter as punishment.
A family with a son and a daughter lived in a faraway land.
One day the parents sent the son to work their fields.
The brother asked his sister to bring him lunch later.
He told her to follow the trail with his footprints.
A witch overheard the conversation.
The witch then erased the brother's footprints and put her own on a path to her hut.
Later that day, when lunch was ready, the girl's mother asked her to bring it to her brother.
The girl left and followed the path with the footprints and got to the witch's hut.
The witch grabbed the girl and locked her in the basement.
The brother came back hungry and asked about his sister.
He became concerned and went looking for her.
On his way, he found a merchant.
The merchant promised him money if he ate a frog.
The brother declined.
When the merchant left, the frog thanked the brother and befriended him.
The brother told the frog about his missing sister.
The frog told him where to find the witch's hut.
When they arrived, the frog lured the witch outside and the brother was able to sneak in and rescue his sister.
They returned home safe and sound.
A poor traveling gypsy and his son got lost in the woods.
Late at night they found a tower and asked for help.
A little frog let them in.
The frog told them that they could stay the night but asked them not to go upstairs.
In the middle of the night, they heard noise upstairs and went to check it out.
There was a witch.
She converted the father into a lizard.
The witch told the little boy that if he wanted to see his father again, he'd need to steal her hat.
The boy agreed but the witch was too fast and he couldn't get her hat.
That night, the frog told the boy she was also a prisoner.
She asked the boy to take her with him.
The boy agreed and the frog gave the boy a magic ring that would turn him invisible.
With the magic ring, the boy walked to the witch and stole her hat.
The witch then restored the boy's father and transformed the frog into a beautiful princess.
The boy and the princess got married and all lived happy in the palace.
The once lived a very poor family.
The parents didn't even have food to sustain their two sons.
The mother sang about having to abandon their children.
The kids, heard her mother's song and decided to leave themselves.
When they were in the woods they ran into a boar that attacked them.
The boys worked together to fend it off.
The boar left deep scars on the boys but they survived.
They eventually made it to a nearby town.
There was a young man telling everyone that the boar that ruined the crops was gone.
A nearby knight took credit for defeating the boar.
The boys challenged the knight.
They show their scars and everybody believed them.
The knight was discharged without honor for taking credit for the boy's work.
The boys were paid a handsome reward and were able to go back home and support their parents.
Once upon a time, a family lived in an isolated mountain.
They had a son and a daughter.
The father kept his daughter locked in a room.
The daughter was very miserable and cried day and night.
The son decided he had to free his sister.
One day, the son found the spare key to his sister's room.
His father surprised him as he was opening the door.
He told him, he'd let him free his sister if he'd win a game of cards with him.
The boy was very skilled at card games and won.
The boy rescued his sister and left.
The father was enraged and chased after them.
He was so mad that he wanted to eat them both.
The mother saw what was going on.
He tripped her husband and he fell down the mountain and died.
A single mother had a baby girl.
One day she went to the market and took her baby girl with her.
An older widow saw the baby and wanted to take her for herself.
The widow offered to babysit for the single mother while she was shopping.
The mother was very busy and agreed.
The widow took the baby girl with her and ran away.
When the mother couldn't find her baby started singing for her.
A nearby witch heard the song.
The witch offered help the mother find her baby.
The witch gave the mother a melon and told her to treat it as her baby.
Then the melon would point in the right direction to find her baby.
The mother did and the melon pointed towards a food stand.
There, the mother found the widow and confronted her.
The widow claimed the baby was hers.

Nikita pointed to a rabbit.
The rabbit dashed and Baba Yaga could not catch it.
Baba Yaga was ashamed and left.
Nikita came back home safe and sound.
He soon wed a young girl and went to live with her family.
Once there lived Nikita.
One night, Baba Yaga started tormenting the people of his town.
Nikita said he would find a solution.
That night, Nikita scattered beehives around town.
At midnight Baba Yaga appeared but was stung by the bees.
Then Nikita used his shovel to kill Baba Yaga.
Everybody was happy.
There once lived Nikita who used to play the fiddle.
Once day, Nikita playing his fiddle in the forest.
Baba Yaga asked him to teach her to play the fiddle.
He taught Baba Yaga how to play.
Baba Yaga gave him a magic egg.
There was a bad winter.
All the sheep died.
Nikita remembered the magic egg and decided to incubate it.
Out of the egg hatched a hen.
The hen laid golden eggs.
Nikita never had to worry about money again.
There once lived Alenka and Nikita.
They were very poor and had no food.
Baba Yaga once invited them to her hut.
They were reluctant but then trusted Baba Yaga.
They followed her into her hut.
Baba Yaga ordered them to eat a lot of food.
Nikita did and fell asleep.
Alenka didn't but pretended to fall sleep.
Alenka saw Baba Yaga was about to eat them.
She woke her brother and he killed Baba Yaga.
They returned home safe with their stomachs full.
There once was a family.
A king wanted to steal their lands.
One day the father went to the market.
The king kidnapped the father and threw him in jail.
The son went to meet with the king.
The king challenged him to a game of cards.
The king lost.
The king freed the father.
The father and the son returned home.
The son soon married a girl and was happy.
Once there was a girl.
Her parents were away for work.
She was hungry.
She went to the forest.
There she found an apple tree.
She asked the tree for an apple.
The tree gave her a magic apple.
The tree told her to not eat the apple.
Alenka did not eat the apple.
The apple tree was happy and gave Alenka apple seeds.
Alenka went back home.
She and her parents planted the apple seeds, grew the trees and were prosperous.
She and her parents planted the apple seeds, grew the trees and were prosperous.
There once lived a soldier with his son.
The soldier trained his son to be like him.
The villagers asked the soldier to leave town.
While they were away, thieves robbed the town.
When the soldier knew he didnt want to go back.
The son went back.
His strength was with him.
The son fought the thieves.
He killed every one of them.
He married a nice girl from town and was happy.
A king had twin daughters.
Their mother died at childbirth.
The daughters were very lonely.
One day the daughters went to the forest.
There they found a trapped goblin.
The goblin asked them for help.
The older daughter ran away scared.
The younger daughter stayed and helped him.
The goblin gave Alenka a new appearance.
When the daughters returned, an evil prince had conquered their castle.
Nobody recognized her.
The prince executed her sister.
He married the daughter and they were happy.
There once lived a boy who was very light.
He was very lonely.
He was so light that one day he drifted away.
He flow to another kingdom.
In that kingdom, the king held a feast.
The king wanted to see who could eat more than him.
Nikita ate three cows.
The king was impressed by his feat.
The king married his daughter to Nikita and made him a prince.
Once, there was Nikita and Alenka who loved each other.
On the day of the wedding, Baba Yaga cast a spell on Nikita.
Nikita forgot about his lover.
Alenka implored Baba Yaga to bring back his memories.
Baba Yaga asked for Alenkas eyes.
Alenka gave her eyes away.
Baba Yaga had tricked Alenka and just left.
Alenka was very sad and sang a sad song.
Then Nikita heard the song.
He remembered his lover.
He loved her sacrifice and they got married immediately.
Once, there was a man and a woman who loved each other.
On the day of the wedding, a witch cast a spell on the husband.
The man forgot about his lover.
The woman implored the witch to bring back his memories.
The witch asked for the womans eyes.
The woman gave her eyes away.
The witch had tricked the woman and just left.
The woman was very sad and sang a sad song.
Then the man heard the song.
He remembered his lover.
He loved her sacrifice and they got married immediately.
An old widower lived with his daughter Alenka.
The widower eventually married another woman who had a daughter called Misha.
Misha despised Alenka.
Misha asked her father to kill Alenka.
The father took Alenka to the forest and left her there to die.
Baba Yaga saw Alenka and asked her how she was doing.
Alenka was kind to Baba Yaga and they talked all night long.
Baba Yaga thanked Alenka for their conversation.
As a token of appreciation, he gave her new clothes and jewelry.
The next morning, the father went back to the forest to retrieve Alenka's corpse.
He was very happy to see Alenka still alive and they went back to the farm.
When the stepmother saw the clothes and jewelry she got very excited.
She asked her husband to take Misha to the forest.
The husband took Misha to the forest and left her in the same spot.
Baba Yaga saw Misha and approached her.
Misha was repulsed by Baba Yaga and was mean to her.
Baba Yaga killed Misha as punishment.
The next morning, the father went back to the forest to retrieve Misha.
He went back home with Misha's corpse.
When the mother saw dead Misha she died of sadness herself.
Alenka and her father lived happily and she eventually married Nikita.
